abstract.text: Measures the performance of a block of code, optionally deferring the starting point for measurement.

inlineContent.text: An array of performance metrics to measure. Each metric is measured across calls to the block. Pass
to measure the number of seconds taken to execute the  block of code.

, measurements will not be taken until

A block whose performance is measured.
Call this method from within a test method to measure the performance of a block of code. This method provides more granular control over performance measurement than the
method, and should be used when you need to customize the points at which measurement starts and ends within the block, or wish to measure multiple metrics for the block.
Performance measurement must be started and stopped exactly once within the block. As a result:
If
is
and
is called inside the block, the test will fail.
If
is
must be called once and only once before the end of the block, or the test will fail.
If
is called multiple times during the block the test will fail.

abstract.text: Create and run unit tests, performance tests, and UI tests for your Xcode project.
Performance metrics that the test records.
A performance metric that records the time in seconds to execute a block of code.
The primary class for defining test cases, test methods, and performance tests.
The default measurement options the test uses to record performance.
An array of default metrics the test uses to record performance.
An array of default performance metrics the test records.
Measures the performance of a block of code.
Records the selected metrics for a block of code.
Records the selected metrics, using the specified measurement options, for a block of code.
Records the performance, using the specified measurement options, for a block of code.
Measures the performance of a block of code, optionally deferring the starting point for measurement.
Starts recording performance metrics within a block of code.
Ends recording performance metrics within a block of code.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
